sentences.sContent: Then it’s really no more than a means of transportation, it too loses its luster.
sentences.sContent_eng: Then it’s really no more than a means of transportation, it too loses its luster.
sentences.sCn: 然后它就仅仅是一个名符其实的交通工具，失去了它的光彩。

sentences.sContent: College graduates may be losing some of their luster for reasons beyond technology and trade.
sentences.sContent_eng: College graduates may be losing some of their luster for reasons beyond technology and trade.
sentences.sCn: 大学毕业生也许会因为技术和贸易之外的原因失去一些光彩。

sentences.sContent: No one knows for sure when the tide started to turn, or the exact moment when American gold started its slow but seemingly irreversible loss of luster.
sentences.sContent_eng: No one knows for sure when the tide started to turn, or the exact moment when American gold started its slow but seemingly irreversible loss of luster.
sentences.sCn: 无人确切知晓这波潮汐的消退始于何时，也没有人精确的得知美金的光泽从何时起开始缓慢，但不可逆转的褪色。

remMethod.val: lus(光) + ter → 光亮， 光泽

words.tran: 表面有金属光泽的陶瓷器
